From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "tat"

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Tats
Wikipedia

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Tati

Etymology

[edit]

Ultimately from Proto-Turkic *tāt (“alien, stranger, pagan”).[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /tɑːt/
  • Rhymes: -ɑːt

Noun

[edit]

Tat (plural Tats or Tat)

  1. A member of an Iranian people, presently living within Azerbaijan, Armenia and southern Dagestan in Russia.

Translations

[edit]
member of an Iranian people
  • Finnish: tati (fi)
  • Georgian: თათი (ka) (tati)
  • Tat: zuhun tati

Proper noun

[edit]

Tat

  1. A southwestern Iranian language spoken by the Tat people.
    Synonym: Caucasian Persian

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Judeo-Tat

Translations

[edit]
language
  • Armenian: թաթերեն (hy) (tʻatʻeren)
  • Bartangi: Тати зив (Tati ziv)
  • Finnish: tati (fi)
  • Russian: татский (ru) (tatskij)
  • Sarikoli: Тати зив, Tati ziv
  • Shughni: Тати зив (Tati ziv)
  • Tat: zuban tati, zuhun tati

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Róna-Tas, András; Berta, Árpád; Károly, László (2011), West Old Turkic: Turkic Loanwords in Hungarian (Turcologica; 84), volume II, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz Verlag, pages 926-928

Further reading

[edit]
  • Ethnologue entry for Tat, ttt ⁠

Anagrams

[edit]
  • AT&T, att, att., at&t

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • That

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German tāt, from Old High German tāt (akin to Old Saxon dād), from Proto-West Germanic *dādi.

Compare Low German Daad/Daat, Dutch daad, English deed, Danish dåd, Gothic *𐌳𐌴𐌸𐍃 (*dēþs), and Ancient Greek θέσις (thésis, “arrangement”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /taːt/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aːt
  • Homophone: tat

Noun

[edit]

Tat f (genitive Tat, plural Taten)

  1. deed
  2. act, action
    ein Mann der Tat ― a man of action
  3. (law) crime, offense

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Tat [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Tat die Taten
genitive einer der Tat der Taten
dative einer der Tat den Taten
accusative eine die Tat die Taten

Hyponyms

[edit]
  • Beziehungstat
  • Bluttat
  • Gewalttat (“act of violence”)
  • Gräueltat
  • Heldentat
  • Missetat
  • Schandtat (“foul or wicked deed”)
  • Straftat

Derived terms

[edit]
  • auf frischer Tat
  • in der Tat
  • tatenlos
  • Täter
  • Tatort
  • Tatverdacht
  • Tatvorwurf
  • Untat

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Tat” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Tat” in Uni Leipzig: Wortschatz-Lexikon
  • “Tat” in Duden online
  • Tat on the German Wikipedia.Wikipedia de
